<p><a href="http://bit.ly/1g3XIuJ"><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/3b260fba715b6c4939ebe029c4750dbc/tumblr_inline_n5j4s031h21rr2wit.jpg"/></a></p>

<p><span>We’ve pulled back from the experimentals phase of development to provide a more robust experience for update 0.24. <strong>HarvesteR</strong> explains it all <a href="http://bit.ly/1g3XIuJ"><strong>HERE</strong></a>. </span><span>Thanks to RocketPilot573 for the pic.</span></p>

I am actually very happy that the update was pushed back because people wanted to have it pushed back. This reminds me of the Soyuz 1 mission. Such a shame that a really great cosmonaut was killed because of a (more or less arbitrary) deadline.

Thanks for taking the time to make 0.24 better, and I'm more excited than ever to see what wonders it will bring.

Agreed, quality over quantity. Honestly, I wasn't that excited about a contracts system that would have been disconnected from the rest of career mode. Releasing contracts and money together makes perfect sense.
I was wondering what the point of contracts would be without the need for money
Wait. Money?

It seem so.

Now I won't be able to wait for the update!!!
Yeah. No more "SLS for a single Stayputnik" launches (at least not if you want to stay in business). Career is gonna get a lot more exciting in the next update.
This is very good news.

This reminds me of the Soyuz 1 mission.

We certainly don't want Jeb to end up like Vladimir Komarov

Seriously though, I cannot wait for the new career mode features as well as mission control
Very good decision to delay the Contract feature until there is at least a rudimentary reason for them (budgets). Even more excited for .24 now!
I was looking forward to getting the update soon, but I can definitely live with a delay if it means more meat gets added. Take your time, guys.
Yeah, I'd rather play an update with substance than a half-implemented system.

It makes sense. The tech tree needed science and vice versa, so it makes sense that contracts need budgets. Limits is what makes these new systems interesting. The tech tree limited science and science limited the tech tree, keeping them in balance. I figure budgets will easily do this for contracts.

I'm also glad about this news! Yes the extra wait is gonna be killer, but hey I just got my mods configured... I wasn't looking forward to having to update them all in another week anyway! Hopefully this means that after 0.24 we can get an update to polish up some other areas of the game since career mode's taken front and center for what.. three updates now? Good call, HarvesteR! And thanks for telling the rest of us.

Yeah, also happy to have some time with my mods and my current career contraptions. I've been practicing. Chutes on all my boosters, that stage with the sepatrons (Scott Manley) and decouplers.

I wonder, could you set up your parachute deployment height so that boosters would fall fast enough to remain inside the 2km despawn range, and yet not be destroyed on impact. There's gotta be a way... Better dig out Scott Manley's reuseable space program.

Edit: Maybe a probe core and chutes on all discarded ship parts.

Edited May 13, 2014 by Aethon
Good Call. Thanks for keeping the game fun for us.

I say this not as someone who barely has time to play the current version, but as a longtime player who wants the best for the game:

Good. No sense releasing the shell with no content. I'd rather have it all at once. The current game is quite playable and fun. I'll wait.
Thumbs up. Quality is important, no matter what Jebediah ends up doing with it.

Hmm... I tought, that budget was intended to be part of .24 update from the begining. These two things are unseparable, as the Experimentals team figured out. So I am happy that Devs delayed the .24 update and decided to add the Budget feature.
Looks like career mode may finally become a challenge to play. Can't wait!

Hmm... I tought, that budget was intended to be part of .24 update from the begining. These two things are unseparable, as the Experimentals team figured out. So I am happy that Devs delayed the .24 update and decided to add the Budget feature.

From developing point of view it makes sense. With no missions to get money an economy system cripples the player until the next patch.

They just have to make sure everything works out, because faulty missions or an unbalanced economy can ignite forums.
Of course we can wait, no problem.

THIS IS BS!!!!!! WHERE ARE MY PROMISED CONTRACTS!!!!11!!!!!????/?????

Just kidding. Seems to be universal agreement this is the best decision. Besides, the ARM patch wasn't that long ago.
God I feel so hyped for this update! I have loved this game since I bought way back at .15!

For some reason the original post really cracked me up! The headline "HarvesteR's 0.24 Update Update", followed by a picture of a pile of spaceplane wreckage on the runway...

Lol, ahhh, it just struck me funny.
